doc.ContractDescription: BIOMARKERS IN PRECAMBRIAN SEDIMENTARY ROCKS TYPICALLY ARE PRESENT IN CONCENTRATIONS THAT ARE TOO LOW FOR MEASUREMENT OF 13CABUNDANCE WITH CONVENTIONAL TECHNOLOGY. YET, COMPOUND-SPECIFIC CARBON ISOTOPIC ANALYSES CAN PROVIDE VALUABLE INSIGHTS TO CARBON SUBSTRATES AND METABOLISMS OF EARLY ECOSYSTEMS. STABLE CARBON ISOTOPIC DATA FOR THE MOST ANCIENT ORGANIC BIOMARKERS ARE ANTICIPATED TO EXHIBIT SIGNIFICANT VARIABILITY, AS OBSERVED FOR MODERN AND MORE RECENT ENVIRONMENTS. THUS MOLECULAR 13C PATTERNS NOT ONLY OFFER AN EFFECTIVE MEANS TO EVALUATE BIOSIGNATURES OF ANCIENT ECOSYSTEMS, THEY POTENTIALLY ENABLE A BETTER-INFORMED APPROACH TO USING ISOTOPIC SIGNATURES TO VERIFY MOLECULAR AUTHENTICITY. IN ADDITION, CURRENT SAMPLE SIZE REQUIREMENTS LIMIT STUDY OF MICROBIAL BIOMARKERS IN YOUNGER SEDIMENTARY ENVIRONMENTS, WHICH HINDER STUDY OF MOLECULAR BIOMARKER ORIGINS AND ECOSYSTEM SIGNATURES OF CARBON CYCLING AT KEY TIMES DURING EARTH'S HISTORY. THE PROPOSED STUDY WILL BUILD ON RECENT PUBLISHED ADVANCEMENTS THAT HARNESS THE RESOLVING POWER AND LOW FLOWS OF NARROW-BORE CAPILLARY GC. A NEW COMBUSTION INTERFACE WILL BE DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE BAND BROADENING, AND MAINTAIN INTEGRITY OF VERY SHARP AND NARROW PEAKS (250 MS) FROM THE GC COLUMN. THE EFFLUENT OF THE INTERFACE WILL BE EFFICIENTLY TRANSFERRED TO THE ION SOURCE OF THE MASS SPECTROMETER, ENABLING ANALYSIS OF 100% OF ANALYTE. THE HIGH-SENSITIVITY ISOTOPE MASS SPECTROMETER WILL BE CONFIGURED WITH FAST ELECTRONICS THAT ARE CAPABLE OF ACQUIRING DATA ACROSS THESE EXTREMELY NARROW PEAK WIDTHS. PICOMOLE-SCALE COMPOUND-SPECIFIC CARBON ISOTOPE ANALYSES (PICO-CSIA) WILL BE DEVELOPED BY A HIGHLY EXPERIENCED TEAM OF INVESTIGATORS AT PENN STATE, LAMONT-DOHERTY EARTH OBSERVATORY AND MIT. APPLICATIONS OF PICO-CSIA CAPABILITY WILL INCLUDE BIOMARKERS FROM MODERN AND ANCIENT ECOSYSTEMS THAT HAVE PREVIOUSLY ELUDED ANALYSIS BECAUSE OF SAMPLE SIZE LIMITATIONS. THESE WILL INCLUDE A MODERN CYANOBACTERIAL-DOMINATED BIOFILM IN A BLUE HOLE IN FLORIDA THAT IS CONSIDERED AN ANALOG FOR PROTEROZOIC OCEANS, AND MICROBIAL COMMUNITIES SAMPLED ACROSS A REDOX GRADIENT IN AN MARINE OXYGEN MINIMUM ZONE OF THE EASTERN TROPICAL NORTH PACIFIC. SAMPLES FROM OPEN-OCEAN SITES WITH SEDIMENTS THAT SPAN THE PALEOCENE-EOCENE PLANETARY HYPERTHERMAL EVENT WILL BE INVESTIGATED TO EVALUATE IMPACTS ON THE PHOTIC ZONE BIOTA OF GLOBAL-SCALE AND PROFOUND CHANGES IN CARBON SUBSTRATES, SPECIFICALLY CARBON DIOXIDE AND METHANE. PICO-CSIA APPLICATIONS IN THIS PROJECT WILL NOTABLY FOCUS ON PRECAMBRIAN BIOMARKERS. THESE WILL BE EVALUATED STARTING WITH RELATIVELY ABUNDANT BIOMARKERS IN NEOPROTEROZOIC (OMAN; 540-600 MA) OILS AND SEDIMENT CORES, AND PROGRESS BACKWARD IN TIME TO INCLUDE SEDIMENT CORE SAMPLES THROUGH THE PROTEROZOIC, INCLUDING THE COASTESLAKE GROUP (CANADA; CA. 750 MA) AND THE MCARTHUR BASIN (AUSTRALIA; CA. 1640 MA). WITH EXPERIENCED GAINED FROM ANALYSES OF THESE MATERIALS, ISOTOPIC ANALYSES WILL THEN BE CONDUCTED ON BIOMARKERS FROM RELATIVELY RECENTLY COLLECTED CORES THROUGH THE TRANSVAAL SUPERGROUP (SOUTH AFRICA; CA. 2500 MA). THIS STUDY WILL BE THE FIRST COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH TO METHOD DEVELOPMENT, MEASUREMENT, DATA ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION FOR THIS IMPORTANT ARCHIVE AND WILL PROVIDE NEW INSIGHTS TO EARTH'S EARLY BIOSPHERE.

doc.ContractDescription: THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROGRAM IS TO ENABLE INCREASED ANGULAR RESOLUTION AND COLLECTION AREAS FOR FUTURE MAJOR X-RAY OBSERVATORIES BY INCORPORATING CONTROL OF THE MIRROR SURFACES AFTER FAB-RICATION AND MOUNTING. WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A METHOD FOR PREPARING ADJUSTABLE OPTICS WITH INTEGRATED CONTROL ELEMENTS ON CURVED MIRROR SEGMENTS FOR FUTURE X-RAY SPACE TELESCOPES. DEVELOPMENT OF SUCH MIRROR ELEMENTS WILL PROVIDE A MAJOR ADVANCE TO THE FIELD OF X-RAY ASTRONOMY, BY ENABLING MIRRORS WITH HALF AN ARCSECOND ANGULAR RESOLUTION USING THIN, LIGHTWEIGHT GLASS TO SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE THE COLLECTION AREA. THIS IS AN ENABLING TECHNOLOGY FOR MISSION CONCEPTS SUCH AS THE X-RAY SURVEYOR.

doc.ContractDescription: MINING THE INFRARED SKY FOR HIGH-REDSHIFT QUASARS THE SPITZER AND WISE SATELLITES HAVE OPENED UP NEW AVENUES FOR THE STUDY OF ACTIVE GALACTIC NUCLEI (AGN) BY PEERING THROUGH THE DUST SHROUDING HALF (OR MORE) OF AGNS. HOWEVER, DESPITE BEING MORE SENSITIVE TO SHROUDED AGNS, CURRENT SELECTION METHODS BEING USED IN THE MID-IR ARE STILL LARGELY BLIND TO THE HIGHEST REDSHIFT QUASARS--BOTH THOSE THAT ARE SHROUDED AND THOSE THAT ARE NOT (AND SHOULD THEREFORE BE EASY TO FIND). WE DESCRIBE PROJECTS TO IDENTIFY BOTH UNOBSCURED (AT Z>3) AND OBSCURED QUASARS (AT Z>2) THAT HAVE HERETOFORE BEEN MISSED IN SIGNIFICANT NUMBERS. FINDING THE HIGH-Z OBSCURED QUASARS IN LARGE NUMBERS IS CRUCIAL FOR FULFILLING THE LEGACY OF NASA MISSIONS IN THE IR AND X-RAY. WITH THESE QUASARS WE WILL BE ABLE TO PERFORM CLUSTERING ANALYSES THAT BREAK THE DEGENERACY OF MODELS DESCRIBING HOW BLACK HOLES CAN ``FEED BACK" ENERGY TO THE LARGE-SCALE HOST GALAXY, SIGNIFICANTLY INFLUENCING ITS EVOLUTION. WE WILL FURTHER TRACE THE LUMINOSITY FUNCTION OF GALAXIES UNDERGOING ACTIVE ACCRETION FROM LOW-LUMINOSITY AGNS TO LUMINOUS QUASARS--PROBING THE GROWTH OF THE SUPERMASSIVE BLACK HOLES THAT WE SEE TODAY IN THE LOCAL UNIVERSE. OUR NEW INSIGHTS COME ABOUT FROM LEVERAGING NEW SPITZER DATA, PRIMARILY FROM THE PI'S SPITZER-IRAC EQUATORIAL SURVEY (SPIES). THE SPITZER DATA ARE 2.5 MAGNITUDES DEEPER THAN THE "ALLWISE" SURVEY IN A ~125 SQUARE DEGREE, MULTIWAVELENGTH-RICH, EQUATORIAL REGION KNOWN AS SDSS "STRIPE 82". THESE DATA ARE CRUCIAL FOR EXTENDING MID-IR INVESTIGATIONS TO HIGHER REDSHIFTS, BOTH FOR UNOBSCURED AND OBSCURED SOURCES. THE PI'S TEAM ARE AMONG THE WORLD'S EXPERTS IN USING THE PROPOSED MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO FIND BOTH UNOBSCURED (TYPE-1) AND OBSCURED (TYPE-2) QUASARS AND IN USING QUASAR CLUSTERING AND LUMINOSITY FUNCTIONS TO DO CUTTING-EDGE SCIENCE. THE LUMINOSITY FUNCTION AND CLUSTERING ALGORITHMS ARE ALREADY IN PLACE, ALLOWING FOR TIMELY COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT ONCE THE MULTI-WAVELENGTH NASA DATA HAVE BEEN INCORPORATED. THIS PROJECT IS DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE EVOLUTION OF GALAXIES AND TO NASA'S GOAL OF BETTER UNDERSTANDING THE UNIVERSE. MOREOVER, NASA'S DATA ARCHIVE IS CRUCIAL TO THE PROJECT: IT IS ONLY BY USING DATA FROM SPITZER AND WISE THAT WILL ALLOW US TO MORE FULLY UNDERSTAND THE PHYSICS OF QUASARS--BY PROBING THEM AT EPOCHS WHERE THEY ARE BOTH MOST DIFFICULT TO FIND, BUT ALSO THE MOST INFLUENTIAL.

doc.ProductorServiceCode: AC61: R&D- DEFENSE SYSTEM: ELECTRONICS/COMMUNICATION EQUIPMENT (BASIC RESEARCH)

doc.ContractDescription: THE PROPOSED WORK TARGETS THE SSAT1 SUB-TOPIC AFCS-1.2, SUPPORT FOR VERIFICATION OF BLACK-BOX FLIGHT-CRITICAL SYSTEMS (FCS). SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP FORMAL VERIFICATION TECHNIQUES GEARED TOWARDS A COMPONENT-BASED SYSTEM DESIGN OF REALTIME, DISTRIBUTED FCS, WHERE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPONENTS IS OUTSOURCED TO EXTERNAL CONTRACTORS WHO WILL DELIVER BLACKBOX ARTIFACTS, OR WHERE THE FCS IS ASSEMBLED FROM COMMERCIAL OFF-THE-SHELF (COTS) SYSTEMS. THIS PROPOSAL FOCUSES ON SYSTEMS INITIALLY SPECIFIED BY MEANS OF SIMULINK/STATEFLOW MODELS, THE DE-FACTO STANDARD IN AVIONICS INDUSTRY AND C/C++ PROTOTYPICAL IMPLEMENTATIONS. WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES FOR FORMAL VERIFICATION TECHNIQUES THAT TAKE ADVANTAGE OF DESIGN MODELS AND EARLY PROTOTYPE COMPONENT IMPLEMENTATIONS. THE PROPOSAL AIMS TO ACHIEVE A HIGHER DEGREE OF ASSURANCE THAN TRADITIONAL BLACK-BOX TESTING ON FCS ASSEMBLED FROM BLACK-BOX COMPONENTS. OUR TECHNICAL APPROACH IS BASED ON CONTRACT-BASED COMPOSITIONAL VERIFICATION, WITH CONTRACTS COMPUTED AUTOMATICALLY FROM COMPONENT DESIGN MODELS, PROTOTYPE IMPLEMENTATIONS, AND SYSTEM-LEVEL PROPERTIES. THE TECHNICAL APPROACH CONSISTS OF THE FOLLOWING VERIFICATION PHASES: 1. PRE-DELIVERY VERIFICATION STAGE: AT THIS STAGE, THE VERIFICATION FOCUSES ON GENERATING CONTRACTS, A WIDELY USED METHOD FOR ORGANIZING THE INTEGRATION OF COMPONENT-BASED SYSTEMS, FOR THE OUTSOURCED COMPONENT. CONTRACTS SPECIFY THE PRECISE INFORMATION NEEDED TO REASON ABOUT A COMPONENT INTERACTION WITH OTHER PARTS OF THE SYSTEM AS WELL AS SYSTEM-LEVEL PROPERTIES. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL USE CONTRACTS AS THE BASIS FOR VERIFICATION OF FCSS AND TO FACILITATE CONFORMANCE TESTING OF OUTSOURCED BLACK-BOX ARTIFACTS. TO THIS END, THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AUTOMATED TECHNIQUES FOR THE GENERATION OF FORMAL CONTRACTS FOR OUTSOURCED COMPONENTS. WE WILL BUILD ON TECHNIQUES FROM AUTOMATED MODEL INFERENCE, AUTOMATED INVARIANT GENERATION, MODEL CHECKING AND ASSUME/GUARANTEE REASONING. 2. POST-DELIVERY VERIFICATION STAGE: ONCE DELIVERED, AN OUTSOURCED COMPONENT OR COTS MUST BE CHECKED FOR CONFORMANCE TO THE PRESPECIFIED FORMAL CONTRACT. WE WILL PERFORM TWO TYPES OF TESTING AT THIS STAGE: CONTRACT-BASED COMPONENT (UNIT) TESTING AND CONTRACTBASED SYSTEM (INTEGRATION) TESTING. THE FORMER ENSURES THAT THE OUTSOURCED BLACK-BOX COMPONENT CONFORMS TO ITS PRE-SPECIFIED CONTRACT, WHILE THE LATTER CONSIDERS THE ISSUE OF CHECKING THAT THE INTEGRATED BLACK-BOX COMPONENTS DO NOT INTERACT IN UNEXPECTED WAYS, THAT IS, OUTSIDE THE SCOPE OF THEIR INDIVIDUAL CONTRACTS. WE PLAN TO DEVELOP AUTOMATED TECHNIQUES FOR GENERATING TEST CASES FROM CONTRACTS. THE THREE YEARS OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BE DIVIDED AS FOLLOWS: THE FIRST YEAR WILL BE DEDICATED BY FOUNDATIONAL WORK AND TASKS AIMING AT PRE-DELIVERY VERIFICATION TECHNIQUES. WE WILL ALSO BEGIN WORKING ON AUTOMATED TEST-CASE GENERATION. THE SECOND YEAR WILL ADDRESS AUTOMATION OF THE PRE-DELIVERY STAGE AND FOCUS ON DEVELOPING TESTING METHODS FOR THE POST-DELIVERY STAGE, WHICH WILL PARTLY GO ON INTO THE THIRD YEAR. ADDITIONALLY, THE THIRD YEAR WILL FOCUS ON EVALUATING THE DEVELOPED APPROACH AND DOCUMENTING THE RESULTS. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS PROJECT, WE WILL PROVIDE FORMAL VERIFICATION TECHNIQUES AND OPEN SOURCE TOOLS FOR SCALABLE, EXHAUSTIVE REASONING OF SAFETY PROPERTIES OF FCS. WE WILL DEMONSTRATE THE BENEFITS OF THESE TECHNIQUES ON A RELEVANT CASE STUDY, SUCH AS THE CONTROL SYSTEM OF THE GENERIC TRANSPORT MODEL (GTM) FROM NASA. MOREOVER, WE WILL DEMONSTRATE THAT THE PROPOSED TECHNIQUES WILL YIELD A BETTER COVERAGE OF THE FINAL SOFTWARE THAN TRADITIONAL BLACK-BOX TESTING, CONTRIBUTING TO AN INCREASE IN SAFETY.
IGF::OT::IGF EXTERNAL RESEARCH ASSOCIATES PROGRAM (ERAP) FOR STRATEGIC STUDIES INSTITUTE (SSI) LOCATED AT THE U.S. ARMY WAR COLLEGE (USAWC) CARLISLE, PA
